annotations.note: The naming pattern of the built-in cookie stores was deliberately not changed for Thunderbird, but kept for compatibility reasons.
Thunderbird does not support tab groups. This property will always be <code>-1<code> and cannot be changed.
Thunderbird does not support Split View. This property will always be <code>-1<code> and cannot be changed.
The naming pattern of the built-in cookie stores was deliberately not changed for Thunderbird, but kept for compatibility reasons.

The <permission>cookies</permission> permission is required to be able to specify this property. Furthermore, the <permission>contextualIdentities</permission> permission should be requested, to enable the contextual identities feature (enabled by default only on Thunderbird Daily).
The naming pattern of the built-in cookie stores was deliberately not changed for Thunderbird, but kept for compatibility reasons.
This function will throw an error, if a content page is loaded into a non-content tab (its type must be either <var>content</var> or <var>mail</var>).
